title: Geneva Score (Revised) for Pulmonary Embolism
description: Objectifies risk of pulmonary embolism, similar to Wells' score, but without requiring clinical gestalt. Helps determine clinical probability of PE to guide diagnostic workup including D-dimer testing and imaging decisions

parameters.name: previous_dvt_pe
parameters.description: Previous history of deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism

parameters.name: surgery_fracture_past_month
parameters.description: Surgery or lower limb fracture within the past month

parameters.name: active_malignancy
parameters.description: Active malignant condition (currently receiving treatment or within past 6 months)

parameters.name: heart_rate_category
parameters.description: Heart rate category in beats per minute

parameters.name: limb_palpation_edema
parameters.description: Pain on lower limb deep venous palpation and unilateral edema

result.name: geneva_pe_score
result.description: Geneva Score (Revised) for Pulmonary Embolism (0-25 points)

ranges.interpretation: Less than 10% incidence of pulmonary embolism. D-dimer recommended. If D-dimer negative, PE ruled out. If D-dimer positive, consider CT pulmonary angiogram.
20-30% incidence of pulmonary embolism. D-dimer recommended. If D-dimer negative, PE unlikely. If D-dimer positive, CT pulmonary angiogram recommended.
Greater than 60% incidence of pulmonary embolism. Urgent CT pulmonary angiogram recommended. D-dimer not necessary - proceed directly to imaging.

references: Le Gal G, Righini M, Roy PM, et al. Prediction of pulmonary embolism in the emergency department: the revised Geneva score. Ann Intern Med. 2006;144(3):165-171. doi: 10.7326/0003-4819-144-3-200602070-00004.

Klok FA, Mos IC, Nijkeuter M, et al. Simplification of the revised Geneva score for assessing clinical probability of pulmonary embolism. Arch Intern Med. 2008;168(19):2131-2136. doi: 10.1001/archinte.168.19.2131.

Ceriani E, Combescure C, Le Gal G, et al. Clinical prediction rules for pulmonary embolism: a systematic review and meta-analysis. J Thromb Haemost. 2010;8(5):957-970. doi: 10.1111/j.1538-7836.2010.03801.x.
formula: Score = Age >65y (1pt) + Previous DVT/PE (3pts) + Surgery/fracture past month (2pts) + Active malignancy (2pts) + Unilateral limb pain (3pts) + Hemoptysis (2pts) + Heart rate: <75bpm (0pts), 75-94bpm (3pts), â‰¥95bpm (5pts) + Limb palpation pain and unilateral edema (4pts)
notes: Does not require clinical gestalt, unlike Wells' criteria
Validated for outpatient and emergency department use
Should be used in conjunction with D-dimer testing for low and intermediate risk patients
High clinical suspicion should always warrant imaging regardless of score
Comparable performance to Wells' criteria for PE diagnosis
Consider age-adjusted D-dimer cutoffs in elderly patients
